results.title: The impact of combination therapy with metformin and exogenous vitamin D on hypothalamic-pituitary-thyroid axis activity in women with autoimmune thyroiditis and high-normal thyrotropin levels.
results.text_hl: Based on @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ preference, these individuals received either @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (3 g daily) plus @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_D @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014807 @@@vitamin D@@@ (4000 IU daily) (n = 17) or were treated with only @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (3 g daily) (n = 15).

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Kowalcze K, Okopień B. The impact of combination therapy with metformin and exogenous vitamin D on hypothalamic-pituitary-thyroid axis activity in women with autoimmune thyroiditis and high-normal thyrotropin levels. J Clin Pharm Ther. 2020 Dec;45(6):1382-1389. PMID: 32706919

results.title: Thyroid Antibody Titers and Hypothalamic-Pituitary-Thyroid Axis Activity in Levothyroxine-Treated Women With Autoimmune Subclinical Hypothyroidism Receiving Atorvastatin or Metformin.
results.text_hl: ...Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and statins reduce thyroid antibody titers in individuals with @<m>DISEASE_Hashimoto_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050031 @@@Hashimoto thyroiditis@@@.
